Hello "legendking04",

On 8/25/07, legendking04 <legendking04@...> wrote:
> I dunno how to view the source code of the jar file in cmd prompt.

You can view the *contents* of a jar file with the following command:
$  jar -tf path/to/thefile.jar

However, that will only list the file names that are packaged into the
jar file. In order to view the contents of the contents, you'll need
to extract the jar file somewhere using the following command:
$  jar -xf path/to/thefile.jar

Note that the above command extracts the contents to the current
directory so you might want to first copy the jar file to some temp
directory.

Lasse

PS. This is not a JUnit-related question so it would've been better to
ask it on a more appropriate forum such as http://saloon.javaranch.com

--
